The Data

Police data for July to December 2025 shows Ribble Valley averaging 310 crimes per month across its 26 wards â€” by far the lowest of any Lancashire district we track.

For comparison, Lancaster averages 1,250 crimes/month, Chorley 850, and South Ribble 810. Ribble Valley's rate reflects its rural character, lower population density, and relative affluence.

Hotspots

Even in Lancashire's safest borough, some areas see more crime than others:

  • Derby & Thornley: ~35 crimes/month (highest ward)
  • Salthill: ~33 crimes/month (Clitheroe town centre)
  • Littlemoor: ~27 crimes/month
  • Primrose: ~21 crimes/month

The quietest wards (Hurst Green & Whitewell, Chipping, West Bradford & Grindleton) average fewer than 5 crimes per month.

See ward-level crime data on our My Area page.
